@DeathIsUnknown

In case of problems: Disable avast avast self defense, avast shields etc, go in Safe Mode, 
paste the crack into the install directory, exclude the crack in avast, reboor in Normal Mode.
Something like that should work, cause it works for everyone else.

It's not the first time that avast detects the ashBase.dll, and it's not the first time
that people think that the problem cannot be solved. People should learn to use their own 
brain first instead of asking for help or complaining. That's the best way to learn and to 
become more independent.

That's why from now on I won't reply on problems with the ashBase.dll, cause there are no problems 
with it. All the info and help is already provided if you just read and understand it.

READ THIS IF THE CRACK IS DETECTED AND REMOVED BY AVAST (CREDITS GOES TO: locobot12):
-------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Open avast > Real Time shield > File System Shield:
http://www.imagedoll.com/show.php/8895_1.jpg

2. Click on Expert Settings > Exclusions, and click on "Browse":
http://www.imagedoll.com/show.php/8896_2.jpg

3. Browse to the install directory of avast (by default):
C:/Program Files/Alwil Software/Avast5

4. Add the avast folder or cracked ashBase.dll to the Exclusions list of
"File System Shield", and make sure that all three options [R,W,E] are checked!

5. Go to Settings > Exclusion: 
http://www.imagedoll.com/show.php/8898_4.jpg

6. Click on "Add" to add the avast directory or ashBase.dll to the 
Exclusions list (by browsing, as described above):
http://www.imagedoll.com/out.php/i8899_5.jpg

Restart avast to check if avast still detects the cracked ashBase.dll.

If the above steps didnt work avast will detect the cracked ashBase.dll 
if it's started, since avast has to use ashbase.dll when starting!

* If still avast detects the cracked ashBase.dll:
- Go to Expert Settings > click on Actions > Virus, and set it to "Ask", 
so that avast wont auto-delete detected files:
http://www.imagedoll.com/out.php/i8897_3.jpg

Note:
**** 
1. Explore the setting of your software, cause the settings are meant to control your software.
2. If still you don't get it then your IQ seriously needs an upgrade cause this is an old issue, 
and 99,99% of the users know how to solve it on their own.
3. Many people are just to lazy to read and to explore the settings of their software.
4. Point three will be proven if you just come back here in the future and read the new posts.
5. If there are still complaints then consider yourself as being one of the new TeleTubbies.
